meanings.definition: A person who conducts opinion polls.
meanings.sent1: The pollsters called people to ask their opinions on the new law.
meanings.sent2: The pollsters were hired to gather data on public sentiment towards the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The pollsters joked that they could predict the weather based on people's favorite ice cream flavors.
meanings.sent4: The pollsters were like detectives, uncovering hidden thoughts and feelings.
meanings.sent5: The pollsters' job was to listen to what everyone thought and make sense of it all.

meanings.definition: A company that conducts surveys to gather public opinion.
meanings.sent1: The pollsters released their latest findings on consumer preferences.
meanings.sent2: Many businesses rely on pollsters to understand their target market.
meanings.sent3: The pollsters' office was always buzzing with the latest survey results.
meanings.sent4: The pollsters' reports were like windows into the minds of the public.
meanings.sent5: The pollsters' work helped companies make decisions based on what people really wanted.

meanings.definition: The practice of conducting surveys to gather public opinion.
meanings.sent1: The importance of pollsters in shaping public policy cannot be underestimated.
meanings.sent2: Pollsters play a crucial role in understanding the pulse of the nation.
meanings.sent3: The art of being a pollster involved asking the right questions in the right way.
meanings.sent4: In a way, pollsters were like modern-day storytellers, weaving narratives from data.
meanings.sent5: The world of pollsters was filled with charts, graphs, and insights into society.
